title: US judge withdraws approval for abortion pill during Texas case
description: Judge Matthew Kacsmaryk has placed a temporary stay on the FDA approval for mifepristone, used in medication abortions.

title: Israel-Palestine: Qatar working to ‘de-escalate situation’
description: Qatari official says Gulf country in touch with both sides 'in the context of its role as a mediator'.

title: Lula government struggles to rein in deforestation in Brazil
description: Preliminary data finds deforestation in the month of March increased 14 percent over the same month last year.

title: What triggered the increase in violence in the Middle East?
description: Violence raised fears of wider confrontation, as well as questions about what this means for already fractured relations

title: Amid turmoil, Pakistan to launch operation against armed groups
description: Pakistan is in danger of defaulting on its debt while a bruising political battle is raging between govt and ex-PM Khan.

title: One killed, several injured in Tel Aviv attack
description: A 30-year-old man has been killed and four others have been injured in the incident, authorities say.

title: US Justice Clarence Thomas responds to unreported luxury travel
description: The Supreme Court justice says he has 'sought to comply' with rules after ProPublica revealed apparent law violation.

title: Republicans furious at Biden’s Afghanistan review, Democrats mum
description: A review released by the White House largely blamed former President Trump for chaotic US pullout from Afghanistan.

title: Canadian Arctic Snow School hopes to boost climate fight
description: Researchers hope first-ever ‘Arctic Snow School’ in Nunavut will bolster cooperation, understanding of changing region.

title: Who fired rockets into Israel from southern Lebanon?
description: While no group has claimed responsibility, Israel blames the Palestinian group Hamas in Lebanon for barrage of rockets.

title: Peace talks must have ‘Russian interests, concerns’, says Lavrov
description: Earlier this week, Moscow said it had no choice but to continue its more than yearlong offensive in Ukraine.

title: Buenos Aires airport turns into unofficial homeless shelter
description: With inflation and poverty soaring in Argentina, dozens are taking shelter in the capital city's 'Aeroparque' airport.

title: Russia charges WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich with spying: Reports
description: Russian media says the journalist denied the espionage charge, saying he was engaged in journalistic activities.

title: Eritrea’s government should not be allowed to harm peace in Ethiopia
description: President Afwerki's determination to continue his feud with the TPLF is jeopardising stability in the Horn of Africa.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: Rouble tumbles to lowest in a year
description: Rouble falls to lowest against dollar and euro since April last year in the face of a foreign currency crunch in Moscow.

title: How teachers and librarians are subverting book bans in the US
description: Books on race and gender identity are the subject of a record number of book bans in the United States.

title: US job growth strong in March, unemployment falls to 3.5 percent
description: The strong job numbers could lead the Fed to continue to raise interest rates.

title: Saudi-led coalition lifts import restrictions in south Yemen
description: Saudi-backed government says commercial ships will be allowed to dock directly in southern ports, including Aden.

title: Why are migrant children working dangerous jobs in the US?
description: It is an 'open secret' that many children who cross the border into the US alone end up working, experts say.

title: UAE court dismisses S Africa request to extradite Gupta brothers
description: The Guptas, arrested in the UAE in 2022, are accused of siphoning state funds using connections with ex-President Zuma.

title: Ramadan recipe: In Sudan, fuul completes the iftar table
description: Our iftar table is not complete unless it has a dish of hot, well-seasoned fuul, studded with chopped veggies, on it.

title: WHO chief urges China to share information on COVID-19 origins
description: Global health agency scientists say new Chinese study released this week offered some 'clues' on origins but no answers.

description: The two leading regional powers have been at odds for years, backing opposite sides in proxy wars.

title: Pakistan army says top Balochistan separatist leader arrested
description: Gulzar Imam, a 'high-value target' according to military, is founder and leader of banned Baloch Nationalist Army.

title: Two Israeli settlers killed; 3 wounded in West Bank shooting

title: Ethiopia to integrate regional forces into central army, police
description: Ethiopia's 10 regions currently enjoy a degree of autonomy, including having their armies and using their languages.

title: Classified US documents on Ukraine war leaked: NYT
description: War plans spread on social media and reportedly contain details about weapons deliveries, battalion strengths.

title: Spike in anti-Muslim rallies since BJP retook India’s Maharashtra

title: As it turns 75,  the need for WHO remains as vital as ever
description: COVID-19 showed yet again the importance of the WHO's mandate to advance the wellbeing of all people.

title: Japan, S Korea, US concerned over N Korea’s cyber-fundraising
description: The allies say North Korea uses funds from its 'malicious' cyber-operations to finance weapons development.

title: Twenty years after the US invasion, where are Iraq’s antiquities?
description: Thousands of artefacts are being shipped back to Iraq, but many more were taken during the post-invasion looting.

title: China sends warships and aircraft around Taiwan for second day
description: Tensions have increased across the Taiwan Strait after President Tsai Ing-wen met the US House speaker.

title: Israel’s violence is open terrorism — stop calling it ‘clashes’

title: Samsung flags 96 percent plunge in profit amid chip slump

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 408

title: China sanctions Taiwan’s de facto US ambassador over Tsai trip
description: Hsiao Bi-khim and family members barred from China after Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen's US visit.
